title: Senior Strategist
content:
Business area: Experience B2B
Team: Viasat
Location:  London
Contract type: 12-Month Fixed Term Contract 
Full Time/Part time:  Full Time
Reporting into: Strategy Partner
 
Our Vision 
Our vision is to inspire brands and people to impact the world. To create big ideas that make a significant contribution to the planet, society, and the bottom line. We believe in today’s world this is the best way for our clients to achieve sustainable growth.    
We achieve this by breaking down the barriers that restrict talent and ideas, we call this Borderless Creativity.          
Which is why our teams work fluidly across five capabilities: Advertising, Consulting, Experience, PR and Influence, and Health. This allows us to not only operate but innovate at the intersection of capabilities and talent.  We believe impact and magic lie at this intersection. Ogilvy scales this by seamlessly connecting and accessing the deep and diverse cultural expertise of 132 offices in 83 countries in a way that celebrates our commitment to inclusion.    
   
Our mission: We inspire brands and people to impact the world 
How we do it: We innovate and operate at the intersection of people and capabilities  
What we do: Borderless creativity  
 
Introduction to Strategy at Ogilvy 

We want to be the home of Creative Intelligence. 
We put creativity at the heart of everything we do. Because we are a creative network. 
Creativity is the first, greatest competitive advantage in business. Original thinking. 
Strategy is the oxygen for that creativity – knowledge, experience, insight, data, informing or inspiring the work that we do. 
We separate the useful from the interesting, to get to less ordinary answers. 
We’re a diverse bunch of thinkers – Brand Strategists and Data Analysts, Experience Design to Insight, Social Content experts to CRM wizards. 
If that still sounds like somewhere you want to be, read on.

 
About this role: 

Supporting the Strategy Partner in the delivery of a variety of projects and planning tasks for: 

Viasat, a major global satellite communications company. Viasat provide connectivity services for consumer, government, maritime, aviation and other enterprise audiences. We advise Viasat on communications, brand and corporate messaging and channel strategy, as well as marketing strategy and execution. It is important that we act as expert marketers as well as commit to understanding their products and solutions as well, if not better than they do. Affinity with technology is essential. 


Occasional additional tasks to support other B2B clients. 
Reporting to: B2B Strategy Partner

A bit about you: 

5 years+ experience in a strategic planning role 
Significant B2B sector experience: B2B acknowledged as a specialism. 
Enterprise technology, telecoms, or related client experience. Experience in client verticals including aviation, maritime, industrial IoT, energy or defence an additional benefit.

Expectations as a Senior Strategist:
Define the problem: What have we been asked to do, what can we do, what should we do? Reframe the problem to identify new opportunities for the client and agency. 

Deﬁne the true nature of a client problem (decreased loyalty, category or favourability decline, new entrants, changed purchase dynamics) 
Use business data to get to the core of the problem and bring new insight to the client brief. 
Conduct stakeholder interviews and immersions to get to the heart of a business problem. 
Systemically defines business, marketing and comms objectives for all projects worked on and sets KPIs upfront for how they will be measured against. 

Insight Creation: Finding things out, filtering them, rethinking them laterally to inspire. 
Conduct research and use it to create original and innovative insights that shape communications. 

Writes research briefs and proposals. 
Writes frequent trend presentations for client and agency. 
Experience of moderating both quant and qual research. 
Understands and advocates for innovative styles of research (ethnography, semiotics, UX studies etc). 
Provides high quality interpretation of research findings. 
Can design and lead a workshop. 
Quickly identiﬁes the sources of information & insight appropriate to a client problem (existing research, behaviour change data, relevant case studies) 

Set the Path: Giving inspiration, clarity & confidence to the team about what needs to be done. Inspire people around a strategic possibilities and work collaboratively to get to the right answer.

Use new or inspiring methods of briefing or writing of proposals. 
Knows how to brief for an idea vs. execution. 
Leads innovation workstreams. 
Champion of a strategic idea with a client and through their business. 
Creates compelling strategic responses to client problems (tissue decks, strategic responses, paths forward) 

Ideation: Helping creative & other disciplines come up with better ideas, faster. Act as an idea catalyst and develop new and innovative ways for ideas to come to life. 

Develop and moderate creative brainstorms and workshops. 
Develops different territories and briefs teams to explore them. 
Bakes in channel/technology thinking to creative strategy. 
Proactively and consistently articulates 'The Idea' as different from 'The Execution' for creative teams. 

Prototyping and Storytelling: Defining the idea, proving, communicating & selling it. Present compelling stories in original rather than formulaic ways.

Can create pitch standard sell in decks and framing of ideas. 
Can clearly articulate a creative idea and how it works. 
Uses language and visuals that will make presentations memorable. 
Can build narratives to different styles of clients and adapt to different audiences. 
Can lead on pretesting, validating, and adapting and idea to ensure that it has the right impact on brand and business (Link, System 1, Qual, and Quant testing) 

Manifesting the Work: Crafting the experience journey and delivery detail that brings the idea to life. Take a strategic idea and expand across owned, earned and bought media.

Identify and prioritise key barriers & opportunities in an experience journey. 
Create a brand/ product/ business eco-system. 
Can capture detailed requirements of an idea from stakeholder interviews. 
Can write product use cases and user journeys. 
Can create a messaging framework. 

Measurement and Effectiveness: Proving if, how and why the work created real value for the business and consumers. 

Lead the agency teams and clients into consistently proving effectiveness on my brands. 
Consistently sets effectiveness objectives for projects worked on and not just defines KPIs but how ideas are supposed to work to deliver on targets. 
Develops effectiveness models or roadmaps for brands. 
Differentiates between helpful and unhelpful data to enable clients to appreciate its true value and relevance. 
Understands how econometrics studies work and how to apply their results. 
Can lead the writing of Marketing Society effectiveness papers. 
Understands how to get to ROMI calculations.

 
At Ogilvy UK, we want to make sure that you’re set up to grow and develop in your role and enjoy some of the best times of your working career. Our learning and development team are on hand to provide training for you, to help you excel in every aspect of your role. So, if you think you may not have experience in some aspects of this position, don’t worry, and apply away. We’re here to help you grow and nurture your skills.  
 
How we help you Thrive:  

25 days annual leave + 1 Volunteer Day 
Bupa Healthcare (including Bupa health assessment and menopause support) 
Enhanced leave policies or parents and carers
We have a flexible working policy with core working hours between 10am – 4pm. We also operate a 3:2 hybrid working structure 
A 1.5:1 matching pension structure 
Up to £25.00 per month towards physical or online exercise class membership
Opportunity to sign up for Unmind membership, LifeWorks tool and annual eye tests
Learning and development budgets plus enhanced and ongoing wellbeing incentives and activities throughout the year 
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme  
Life Assurance x4 salary  
Inclusion@Ogilvy – our employee networks Ogilvy ReWired, Roots, Equals, PROUD and Parents and Carers. See here for more information  

 
Dedicated to our people, we provide additional perks to help support your work life balance 
 
If this sounds like the right role and company for you, we’d love to hear from you. 
 
Our ambition is to attract the very best diverse talent to Ogilvy, and to be the employer of choice in the UK. We want everyone to feel welcome when they join us, and once they’re here, for them to want to stay with us, grow their career, and to feel they belong with us. 
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and we’re committed to creating an inclusive, welcoming environment for everyone who wants to work at Ogilvy. For us, diversity, equity and inclusion is integrated into everything that we do. We believe that for creativity to flourish, everything about how we work must have diversity at its core. Your race, colour, ethnic, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, have no bearing on our hiring decisions, but we encourage everyone to feel free to express their true selves in an environment we are consistently striving to make as inclusive as possible.  
 
We aim to facilitate an accessible and positive application experience for all candidates. If you require any adjustments from us to support you through the process or expect to require any adjustments to working conditions to be able to best perform in the role, please let us know. We are happy to consider all reasonable adjustments. 


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

demographic_questions.description:
At Ogilvy we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer. We believe in creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity, equity and inclusion.  We strive to recruit from a diverse range of candidates and create an environment which provides the right conditions for belonging. We welcome all applications regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, marital status, , sexual orientation and physical or mental disability etc. (please note this is not an exhaustive list). We are also actively focussed on encouraging greater representation by bringing more under-represented talent into our organisation. This is hugely important to us and Ogilvy has a thriving network of employee communities that exist to help everyone, no matter their background, succeed here.

In order to help us achieve this and hold ourselves accountable for progress and monitor our efforts, we invite you to answer the following questions. You are not required to answer any of them, as they are entirely voluntary. They will also not be viewable to those interviewing you as part of your application or candidate profile. If you choose to answer, please know that all data is stored separately, used in aggregate for reporting purposes and handled as per GDPR regulations.
